Let's
* Split the list view of students and lesson into tabs
* add the commands to update the list and toggle to the
respective tab

Change command word for listing students and lessons to `liststudents`
and `listlessons` respectively.

Change command word for listing students and lessons to `liststudents`
and `listlessons` respectively.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix removal of `lesson` and `student` from `enrolledStudents` and `enrolledLessons`
commitResults.messageBody:
`Lesson` and `Student` was not removed from their respective enrolled students and lessons when they were deleted.

Let's
* update `enrolledStudents` of every `lesson` when a `student` is removed
* update `enrolledLessons` of every `student` when a `lesson` is removed

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix recurring lesson and `assign` command bug
Amend `AssignCommand` to prevent bugs when lists are filtered by other commands
Amend `AssignCommand` to prevent bugs when lists are filtered by other commands
Amend `AssignCommand` to prevent bugs when lists are filtered by other commands
Amend `AssignCommand` to prevent bugs when lists are filtered by other commands
Add switching of tabs when new `Student` or `Lesson` is added
commitResults.messageBody: `addlesson` and `addstudent` command will toggle the tab of the GUI to the lessons or students tab respectively, if not already on the tab. Additionally, details of the new `Lesson` or `Student` added will also be displayed on the InfoPanel.

The command unassigns the `Student` of the given `STUDENT_ID` from the `Lesson` of the given `LESSON_ID`.
* the `Student` is removed from `enrolledStudents` of the `Lesson`
* the `Lesson` is removed from `enrolledLessons` of the `Student`
Move diagram images in the **Add Student** and **Assign** sections of the developer guide to the correct folder. This is done as they were not showing up in GitHub pages.
Lessons in the GUI will be sorted from earliest to latest date and time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Amend `find` commands to toggle to tab after execution
Fix bug where `listlessons` command does not list all lessons after being filtered

commitResults.messageBody: This commit also changes the `DateTimeSlot#equals()` method to include equality comparison of the `minutes` attribute.

commitResults.messageBody:
Main README page did not have a screenshot of our UI mock up and AboutUs page contained old information from the previous AB3 project.

Add a screenshot of our UI mockup and some small changes to the README.
Also add information on Kidsnd274 in the AboutUs page.

Previous commit didn't stage all the files.
Check previous commit for comments.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add further changes to Kidsnd274's PPP
Update Developer Guide with additional details
commitResults.messageBody: Add Target User Profile, Value Proposition and User Stories

commitResults.messageTitle: Switch to a horizontal pane layout Current version of the program has a vertical layout with two lists.
commitResults.messageBody:
In the design mockup, the final version will have a horizontal layout for the list and Person/Lesson details.

This changes it from a vertical layout to a horizontal one with a SplitPane for adjustable width between the list and details pane.

Issues:
- Setting a max or min width for one of the elements in the SplitPane is causing issues with the default divider position.
- Second list with lessons is temporary

commitResults.messageTitle: Add PersonInfoPanel to the right side of the SplitPane Current version shows both person and lesson list but doesn't show more information of either Person or Lesson
commitResults.messageBody:
Add PersonInfoPanel to show more information on Person and follow the mockup more closely.

Issues:
- Setting a max or min width for one of the elements in the SplitPane is causing issues with the default divider position.
-- Still not fixed, need to try to add either divider position limits or min width of list elements
- PersonInfoPanel can't show assigned classes list yet

Todo:
- Implement clicking on the list to show Person/Lesson details
- LessonInfoPanel not added yet

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Assigned Lesson List to PersonInfoPanel and refactor some methods In PersonInfoPanel, assigned lessons are not shown.
commitResults.messageBody:
Assigned Lessons can now be listed in the PersonInfoPanel, although assignedLessons are not stored in Person yet.

Refactor some methods and add two new abstract classes to allow the ListPanel to show both Person and Lessons.
Create new methods to easily populate the ListPanel with either Person/Lessons. Same for the InfoPanel although LessonInfoPanel is not implemented yet.

Issues:
- Person does not store assigned classes so temporary placeholders are used instead

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix alignment and padding issues with InfoPanel
Implement LessonInfoPanel and clean up code into packages Add methods specific to update LessonInfoPanel in MainWindow
commitResults.messageBody: Move classes related to InfoPanel to an infopanel package

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new boolean to CommandResult indicating an InfoPanel update New InfoPanelTypes enumerator indicating the types of possible InfoPanels New NoInfoPanelTypeException for An error that occurs when getInfoPanelType is called when updateInfoPanel is false in CommandResult.

Add new methods to handle selected Person/Lesson The previous version does not store a selected Person/Lesson in the Model. This is a problem as the new UI now has a section to show information of a single Person/Lesson.
commitResults.messageBody:
In Model, a selected person and selected lesson has been added to allow storing the selected Person/Lesson.

New checks in MainWindow to check if the returned CommandResult will update the InfoPanel. If it does, update the InfoPanel with the selected Person/Lesson as mentioned above.

Todo:
- Add test cases for the updating the UI and Person/Lesson and the upcoming new Commands

commitResults.messageTitle: Add commands for viewing Class and Student
commitResults.messageBody:
Issues:
- Not handling situation when calling eg. class 1 while students are displayed. Should pop up an error or deal with it somehow.
Issue: Since Person or Lesson does not contain any list references to assigned classes or enrolled students, when viewing Person or Lesson info, the bottom list disappears.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix issue where InfoPanel overlays new Panels In previous verions, when a new InfoPanel is shown, it overlays the previous version.
commitResults.messageBody: Issue is fixed by clearing the entire InfoPanel before adding a new one.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change all references to class to Lesson This includes the command "class". It has been switched to "lesson". Eg. "lesson 1"
Add test cases for ViewCommands and ViewParsers ViewLessonInfoCommandTest not working yet as TypicalPersons.java does not include lessons yet
Add functionality to swap tab when viewing info In the previous version, viewing a student or lesson info will not swap tabs.
commitResults.messageBody: Added functionality to swap tabs to the respective student/lesson info.

Allow panels to resize according to the UI Size
Restrict Divider Position to 50%

Fix comment showing in actual documentation
Add UserInputHistory class and its components This commit adds the main classes for the User Input History function.
commitResults.messageBody:
In previous versions of TeachWhat, it is not possible to retrieve past user's inputs.
With this new feature, using the arrow keys will allow a user to retrieve past user's inputs, similar to how a terminal works.

Todo:
- Add JavaDocs
- Implement the keyboard shortcut functions in MainWindow
- Add test cases for added components
- Add more assertions

In the previous commit, UserInputHistory was implemented but not used.

Issues:

commitResults.messageBody: In this commit, users must enter `clear -f` to confirm that they want to clear the lesson and student book.

commitResults.messageBody: Deletion is specified by the index that is viewable by the user, e.g. rmlesson 3

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix Checkstyle in DeleteLessonCommand and DeleteLessonCommandParser.
Update Student to have empty address or email
commitResults.messageBody: The tutor does not need to know the address or email of every student. This reduces the length of the command when adding a new student as well by making it optional to include the email or address.

commitResults.messageBody: Having duplicate prefixes may confuse the user as they might not remember that the newest prefix of the same type overrides the older one. Thus, removing this functionality may improve user experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update testcases for the removal of duplicate prefix functionality

commitResults.messageBody: V1.2 will not have edit functionality so they can be removed and disabled in the current iteration.
